text: Obama Station platforms in August 2006 is a railway station located in the city of Obama, Fukui, Japan, operated by West Japan Railway Company (JR West). ==Lines== Obama Station is served by the Obama Line linking in Tsuruga, Fukui with in Maizuru, Kyoto, and is located 49.5 kilometers from the terminus of the line at . ==Station layout== The station has one side platform and one island platform connected by a footbridge. The station has a Midori no Madoguchi staffed ticket office. ===Platforms=== ==Adjacent stations== ==History== Obama Station opened on 10 November 1918. With the privatization of Japanese National Railways (JNR) on 1 April 1987, the station came under the control of JR West. ==Passenger statistics== In fiscal 2016, the station was used by an average of 969 passengers daily (boarding passengers only). ==Surrounding area== *Obama City Hall *site of Obama Castle *site of Nochiseyama Castle * * ==See also== * List of railway stations in Japan ==References== ==External links== * JR West - Obama Station * Station connection details Category:Railway stations in Fukui Prefecture Category:Stations of West Japan Railway Company Category:Railway stations in Japan opened in 1918 Category:Obama Line Category:Obama, Fukui
